title: Man Utd 'made Wojciech Szczesny transfer enquiry' amid David de Gea uncertainty

Manchester United reportedly approached Juventus over signing goalkeeper Wojciech Szczesny amid uncertainty surrounding David de Gea's future during the summer.

Red Devils shot-stopper De Gea was linked with a move away from Old Trafford with his contract entering its final year.

PSG were reported to be interested in his services with United facing another season outside of the Champions League.

But he has since committed his future to United by inking a new long-term deal at the Theatre of Dreams.

According to Goal, United asked Juve about Szczesny's potential availability as they looked for an alternative for the Spaniard should he leave the club.

(Image: AFP/Getty Images)

But they were rebuffed by the Italian giants and Szczesny himself is now apparently set to be rewarded with a new deal as his current contract is set to expire at the end of next season.

The former Arsenal keeper made the switch to Turin from north London via a pair of successful loan spells at Roma.

He was initially signed as the back-up to Gianluigi Buffon but became first-choice as Buffon signed for PSG prior to the start of last season.

Buffon is now back with the Bianconeri but Szczesny has retained the No.1 spot.

Szczesny has made 69 appearances in all for Juve, keeping 35 clean sheets.
description: Szczesny is now on the brink of a new deal at Juventus - but could have been a United player if things panned out differently
